title.narrative: DSIF - Bangladesh - Saidabad Water Project, Phase III

description.narrative: The project will improve health and well-being in the City of Dhaka through construction of a new water plant, with an expected output of clean drinking water for 7 million people. The main raw water source for the city is ground water, but unsustainable rates of abstraction are causing ground water levels to decline between 1-2 meters per year. Consequently, the Government of Bangladesh has decided make a gradual shift to use surface water as source for production of clean water. The programme includes the following three project components: 1) construction of water intake at Meghna River and transmission lines, 2) construction of water treatment plant and sludge treatment facilities and 3) distribution network. DSIF will provide a soft loan for component 2 and component 1 and 3 will be financed by AFD (Agence Française de Développement), EIB (European Investment bank), KfW (Kreditanstalt für Wiederafbau) and the Government of Bangladesh. The programme will provide technical assistance for planning, implementation, management and capacity development.
